results.title: Down by law
results.creator_credit: Black Snake, Grokenberger, Alan Kleinberg and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: It is a sad and beautiful world that provides the setting for Jim Jarmusch’s third feature. It seems like a world of bad luck and trouble to Jack and Zack. These deadbeats may well have deserved a comeuppance, but not jail, certainly not for the long haul, and absolutely not in the same cell together. The big-talking, foolish Jack and the sullen, daydreaming Zack are mutually repellent. A new convict is pushed into their cell, an Italian tourist, Roberto. Somehow the three manage to escape and they wind up in the trackless bayou, pursued by bloodhounds. stars Tom Waits, John Lurie, Roberto Benigni and Ellen Barkin.

results.title: Down and out in Beverly Hills
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Paul Mazursky and Pato Guzman
results.brief_description: A wealthy but bitterly unhappy married couple take in a tramp who attempts suicide in their pool. Becoming ensconced in their lives, the tramp (played by Nick Nolte) facilitates a re-evaluation of the family’s dubious moral codes. A remake of Jean Renoir’s 1932 film “Boudu saved from drowning” this hilarious comedy with Richard Dreyfuss and Bette Midler as the warring couple, garnered many accolades and was nominated for two Golden Globes.

results.creator_credit: Peter Lord, David Sproxton, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Based on a real life conversation, clay models are animated to act out the problems of a man attempting to get a meal from a welfare agency.

results.title: Down and out
results.creator_credit: Journal Films and Gilbert Altschul Productions
results.brief_description: The film depicts one of the most common causes of injury in workshop situations - falling. It examines the common hazards which cause people to lose their balance; over-reaching, taking short cuts, failure to check eqiupment, and not looking where one is going.

results.title: down among the wild men / colonial imagination
results.material_description: Video loop, artist and Michael Bonner (performer)
results.brief_description: Shadow play, projection and performance combine to question our history and shift the colonial gaze in Ali Gumillya Baker’s mixed media video installation.

constellations_primary.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_primary.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Keep the fire burning
constellations_other.description: Yanmeeyarr, meaning ‘flickering in firelight’, shares how light and shadow are at the core of the moving image. It reflects the past, present and future of stories told by First Peoples utilising these elements, as well as bringing to light stories that have, for too long, been kept in the dark.

results.title_for_label: down among the wild men / colonial imagination
results.description:
Shadow play, projection and performance combine to question our history and shift the colonial gaze in Ali Gumillya Baker’s mixed media video installation.

“This is a violent black tragedy, a cathartic melodrama. Dressed in a tall ship hat pretending to be a colonialist, the Mirning artist writes with her feather quill back to the colonial-mother-monarch of her times ‘down among the wild men’. From the shade of the gum tree. At the same time as her chronicling, she is attacked by a wild man, (fellow sovereign Yanyuwa artist), who with a super large fork pretend stabs her in the back and the pretend explorer/tall ship coloniser collapses. Even the trees are scared of us blackfellas the hand holding the tree is shaking in fear. The background soundtrack that the viewer cannot hear is us all laughing maniacally at the re-enactment of the anthropological and colonial gaze.” - Ali Gumillya Baker
description_for_label:
Shadow play, projection and performance combine to question our history and shift the colonial gaze in Ali Gumillya Baker’s mixed media video installation.

“This is a violent black tragedy, a cathartic melodrama. Dressed in a tall ship hat pretending to be a colonialist, the Mirning artist writes with her feather quill back to the colonial-mother-monarch of her times ‘down among the wild men’. From the shade of the gum tree. At the same time as her chronicling, she is attacked by a wild man, (fellow sovereign Yanyuwa artist), who with a super large fork pretend stabs her in the back and the pretend explorer/tall ship coloniser collapses. Even the trees are scared of us blackfellas the hand holding the tree is shaking in fear. The background soundtrack that the viewer cannot hear is us all laughing maniacally at the re-enactment of the anthropological and colonial gaze.” - Ali Gumillya Baker

results.title: Down a long way: the story of an oilwell
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Petroleum and Bob Privett
results.brief_description: Light-hearted animation describes methods of finding oil. Geologists can deduce the presence of a favourable underground formation from surface observations, and the geophysicist can then site a well, with some accuracy, by plotting the actual shape of the underground strata. Describes drilling and sampling operations which give access to the imprisoned oil.

results.title: Dovetail a drawer
results.brief_description: Explains everything from cutting the stock to size, running the groove for the drawer bottom, to cutting the dovetails and glueing up and fitting the drawer. Shows how to use a hacksaw, a chisel, and a smoothing plane with new confidence, how to rip, crosscut and plow on power machinery, how to organise the whole drawer making process from layout to finishing touches.

results.title: Dover: spring 1947
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions, Papua New Guinea. Office of Information and Mary Beales
results.brief_description: A study of the rebuilding program of the English Channel town of Dover, which suffered heavy damage from shellfire during WWII. The historic town is to be, very largely, rebuilt on a new site, and extensive use is to be made of recently developed prefabrication techniques. Good use of British humour gives this doco additional interest.

results.title: Douglas Stewart
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
Playwright and poet, Douglas Stewart, was for many years the Literary Editor of the Bulletin, and friend of many writers and artists, including Norman Lindsay, Judith Wright and David Campbell.

results.title: Douglas Point Nuclear Power Station
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Atomic Energy of Canada
results.brief_description: The success of this first full-scale nuclear power station on the shores of Lake Huron has shown the way for the economic large-scale production of electricity from uranium. This film describes the plant at Douglas Point, Ontario, and the process by which the uranium atom is split, employing heavy water with a special property, deuterium, giving the name CANDU (Canada Deuterium Uranium) to the Canadian system of atomic energy production.
